title: Đorđe Lazović (footballer, born 1992)
text:
Đorđe Lazović (; born 16 November 1992) is a Serbian professional <a href="Association%20football">football</a> <a href="Goalkeeper%20%28association%20football%29">goalkeeper</a>.
Club career.
Lazović came through the youth system of <a href="FK%20Vojvodina">Vojvodina</a>, being promoted to the senior squad in early 2010. He was loaned to <a href="Serbian%20League%20Vojvodina">Serbian League Vojvodina</a> club <a href="FK%20Pali%C4%87">Palić</a> ahead of the <a href="2010%E2%80%9311%20Serbian%20League%20Vojvodina">2010–11 season</a>, before returning to Vojvodina in early 2011. After the end of the first part of the <a href="2011%E2%80%9312%20FK%20Vojvodina%20season">2011–12 season</a>, Lazović went on loan to <a href="FK%20Dunav%20Stari%20Banovci">Dunav Stari Banovci</a> in early 2012.
In the summer of 2012, Lazović moved on loan to <a href="FK%20Javor%20Ivanjica">Javor Ivanjica</a>. He spent two seasons at the club, making his <a href="Serbian%20SuperLiga">Serbian SuperLiga</a> debuts in <a href="2012%E2%80%9313%20Serbian%20SuperLiga">2013</a>. After leaving Ivanjica in the summer of 2014, Lazović was on the rosters of <a href="FK%20Spartak%20Subotica">Spartak Subotica</a> and <a href="OFK%20Beograd">OFK Beograd</a>, however failed to make a competitive debut.
In late 2016, early 2017, Lazović trained with <a href="FK%20Partizan">Partizan</a>. Shortly after he signed a two-year contract with club, he was optionally loaned to satellite club <a href="FK%20Teleoptik">Teleoptik</a> until the end of 2016–17 season, but stayed in club playing with reserves. He released by the club at the beginning on 29 January 2018, after which he moved to <a href="FK%20Radni%C4%8Dki%20Ni%C5%A1">Radnički Niš</a>.
International career.
In 2013 and 2014, Lazović received several call-ups for the <a href="Serbia%20national%20under-21%20football%20team">Serbia national under-21 team</a>
